weeks.desc: This week's content doesn't really depend on any of the lectures! We'll be familiarising ourselves again with concepts from COMP1[59]11.

files.name: for_loops.c
files.desc: An intro to for loops, which are really just spicy while loops.

files.name: static.c
files.desc: A demo of the static keyword on variables inside functions.

files.name: struct.c
files.desc: A refresher on how to use structs in C.

files.name: args.c
files.desc: A refresher on reading in input from command line arguments.

files.name: recursion.c
files.desc: An example using recursion to print an array.

files.name: bad_strings.c
files.desc: A demo of an error when initialisng strings. Why does this happen?

files.name: literals.c
files.desc: Hardcoded strings behave slightly differently in C.

links.name: All code is also in a GitHub repo, if you'd prefer that instead.

weeks.desc: This week focuses on bitwise operations, and converting numbers to binary and hexadecimal!

weeks.topic: Two's complement and floating point numbers
weeks.desc: This week's lab heavily involve manipulating bits of floating point numbers.
We get started with MIPS - labs include printing, if statements and for loops.

files.name: square.c
files.desc: Print a square number in C.

files.name: square.s
files.desc: Print a square number in MIPS.

files.name: square_max.c
files.desc: Print a square number in C, with a limit to prevent overflows.

files.name: square_max.s
files.desc: Print a square number in MIPS, with a limit to prevent overflows.

weeks.desc: This week's a chonky one - we look at two weeks of content, preparing for the first assignment, snake.

files.name: variables.c
files.desc: Some C variables we want to represent as MIPS data.

files.name: variables.s
files.desc: Our variables, now in âœ¨ MIPS âœ¨.

files.name: do_while.c
files.desc: The all new do-while loop - a slightly cooler while loop.

files.name: do_while.s
files.desc: The do-while loop, but in MIPS.

files.name: scan_and_print.c
files.desc: Scanning 5 numbers into an array, and then printing them.

files.name: scan_and_print.s
files.desc: Scanning 5 numbers into an array, and then printing them, but in MIPS!

files.name: fib.c
files.desc: A simple fibonacci implementation (without memoization) in C.

files.name: fib.simple.c
files.desc: A fibonacci implementation made simpler to translate!

files.name: fib.s
files.desc: Our simple fibonacci implementation, made slightly less simple by being implemented in MIPS.

weeks.topic: Some MIPS Revision, and some hacking ðŸ‘€
weeks.desc: We covered a good chunk of this week's content in Week 5, so there isn't that much here!

files.name: sizeof.c
files.desc: A program we can use in order to determine the size of a struct.

files.name: struct.c
files.desc: A look at how structs are laid out in memory.

files.name: unalign.s
files.desc: A demo of attempting an unaligned read of memory in MIPS.

files.name: ptr.c
files.desc: Doing some hacky stuff with casts in C to do evil things with pointers.

files.name: vuln.c
files.desc: Bonus content - why using system can lead to security vulnerabilities! You aren't expected to understand most of this code.

weeks.desc: We take a look at some process related stuff, as well as some content related to the pathfinder lab.

files.name: access.c
files.desc: Using access to determine if the user has permissions to execute a file.

files.name: fork.c
files.desc: Some basic code demonstrating forking a process.

files.name: fork-2.c
files.desc: Some more code demonstrating forking, and non-determinism thanks to scheduling.

files.name: basic-spawn.c
files.desc: A tutorial example where I demonstrated the fork-execve method of creating new processes, compared to posix_spawn.

weeks.desc: We take a peek into files and file systems!

files.name: 0-q2.md
files.desc: A look at the typical Unix file system structure.

files.name: 1-q3.md
files.desc: Looking at the (very similar) stat and lstat functions.

files.name: 2-q3.c
files.desc: Some code to look at the fields of struct stat.

files.name: 3-q4.md
files.desc: Understanding the output of the ls command, and symlinks.

files.name: 4-q5.c
files.desc: Using stat(2) to determine permissions on a file, and chmod(2) to update permissions.

files.name: 5-fopen.c
files.desc: A look at the fopen(3) library function.

files.name: 6-firstline.c
files.desc: A program to print the first line of a file, similar to the output of the `head -1` command.

files.name: 7-fgrep.c
files.desc: A program which produces output similar to fgrep, but without the re.

files.name: 8-write_line.c
files.desc: A program which reads from stdin and writes to a file.

files.name: 9-q13-cursed.c
files.desc: A solution to a cursed tutorial question.

files.name: 10-io.c
files.desc: Some final IO related content.
